label: Acidity
definition: a naturally occurring component of every wine; the level of perceived sharpness; a key element to a wine's longevity; a leading determinant of balance.

label: Alcohol
definition: the end product of fermentation; technically ethyl alcohol resulting from the interaction of natural grape sugars and yeast; generally above 12.5 percent in dry table wines.

label: Alsace
definition: a highly regarded wine region in eastern france renowned for dry and sweet wines made from riesling, gewuerztraminer, pinot blanc, pinot gris, and others.

label: Amarone
definition: a succulent higher-alcohol red wine hailing from the veneto region in northern italy; made primarily from corvina grapes dried on racks before pressing.

label: AOC
definition: appellation diorigine controlee, a french term for a denominated, governed wine region such as margaux or nuits-st.-georges.

label: Aroma
definition: a scent thatis a component of the bouquet or nose; i.e. cherry is an aromatic component of a fruity bouquet.

label: AVA
definition: american viticultural area; a denominated american wine region approved by the bureau of alcohol, tobacco, and firearms.

label: Bacchus
definition: the roman god of wine, known as dionysus in ancient greece; a hybrid white grape from germany.

label: Balance
definition: the level of harmony between acidity, tannins, fruit, oak, and other elements in a wine; a perceived quality that is more individual than scientific.

label: Barrel Fermented
definition: a process by which wine (usually white) is fermented in oak barrels rather than in stainless steel tanks; a richer, creamier, oakier style of wine.

label: Barrique
definition: french for 'barrel,' generally a barrel of 225 liters.

label: Beaujolais
definition: a juicy, flavorful red wine made from gamay grapes grown in the region of the same name.

label: Beaujolais Nouveau
definition: the first beaujolais wine of the harvest; its annual release date is the third thursday in november.

label: Blanc de Blancs
definition: the name for champagne made entirely from chardonnay grapes.

label: Blanc de Noirs
definition: the name for champagne made entirely from red grapes, either pinot noir or pinot meunier, or both.

label: Blend
definition: the process whereby two or more grape varieties are combined after separate fermentation; common blends include cotes de rhone and red and white bordeaux.

label: Blush
definition: a wine made from red grapes but which appears pink or salmon in color because the grape skins were removed from the fermenting juice before more color could be imparted; more commonly referred to as rose.

label: Bodega
definition: spanish for winery; literally the 'room where barrels are stored.'

label: Body
definition: the impression of weight on one's palate; light, medium, and full are common body qualifiers.

label: Bordeaux
definition: a city on the garonne river in southwest france; a large wine-producing region with more than a dozen subregions; a red wine made mostly from cabernet sauvignon, merlot, and cabernet franc; a white wine made from sauvignon blanc and semillon.

label: Botrytis Cinerea
definition: a beneficial mold that causes grapes to shrivel and sugars to concentrate, resulting in sweet, unctuous wines; common botryt's wines include sauternes, tokay, and german beerenauslese.

label: Bouquet
definition: the sum of a wine's aromas; how a wine smells as a whole; a key determinant of quality.

label: Breathe
definition: the process of letting a wine open up via the introduction of air

label: Brix
definition: a scale used to measure the level of sugar in unfermented grapes. multiplying brix by 0.55 will yield a wine's future alcohol level.

label: Brut
definition: a french term used to describe the driest champagnes.

label: Burgundy
definition: a prominent french wine region stretching from chablis in the north to lyons in the south; pinot noir is the grape for red burgundy, chardonnay for white.

label: Cabernet Franc
definition: a red grape common to bordeaux; characteristics include an herbal, leafy flavor and a soft, fleshy texture.

label: Cabernet Sauvignon
definition: a powerful, tannic red grape of noble heritage; the base grape for many red bordeaux and most of the best red wines from california, washington, chile, and south africa; capable of aging for decades.

label: Cap
definition: grape solids like pits, skins, and stems that rise to the top of a tank during fermentation; what gives red wines color, tannins and weight.

label: Cava
definition: spanish for 'cellar,' but also a spanish sparkling wine made in the traditional champagne style from xarello, macabeo, and parellada grapes.

label: Chablis
definition: a town and wine region east of paris known for steely, minerally chardonnay.

label: Champagne
definition: a denominated region northeast of paris in which chardonnay, pinot noir, and pinot meunier grapes are made into sparkling wine.

label: Chaptalization
definition: the process of adding sugar to fermenting grapes in order to increase alcohol.

label: Chardonnay
definition: arguably the best and most widely planted white wine grape in the world.

label: Chateau
definition: french for 'castle;' an estate with its own vineyards.

label: Chenin Blanc
definition: a white grape common in the loire valley of france.

label: Chianti
definition: a scenic, hilly section of tuscany known for fruity red wines made mostly from sangiovese grapes.

label: Claret
definition: an english name for red bordeaux.

label: Clos
definition: pronounced 'cloh,' this french word once applied only to vineyards surrounded by walls.

label: Color
definition: a key determinant of a wine's age and quality; white wines grow darker in color as they age while red wines turn brownish orange.

label: Cooperative
definition: a winery owned jointly by multiple grape growers.

label: Corked
definition: a wine with musty, mushroomy aromas and flavors resulting from a cork tainted by tca (trichloroanisol).

label: Crianza
definition: a spanish term for a red wine that has been aged in oak barrels for at least one year.

label: Cru
definition: a french term for ranking a wineis inherent quality, i.e. cru bourgeois, cru classe, premier cru, and grand cru.

label: Decant
definition: the process of transferring wine from a bottle to another holding vessel. the purpose is generally to aerate a young wine or to separate an older wine from any sediment.

label: Denominacion de Origen
definition: spanish for 'appellation of origin;' like the french aoc or italian doc.

label: Denominazione di Origine Controllata
definition: italian for a controlled wine region; similar to the french aoc or spanish do.

label: Disgorge
definition: the process by which final sediments are removed from traditionally made sparkling wines prior to the adding of the dosage.

label: Dosage
definition: a sweetened spirit added at the very end to champagne and other traditionally made sparkling wines. it determines whether a wine is brut, extra dry, dry, or semisweet.

label: Douro
definition: a river in portugal as well as the wine region famous for producing port wines.

label: Dry
definition: a wine containing no more than 0.2 percent unfermented sugar.

label: Earthy
definition: a term used to describe aromas and flavors that have a certain soil-like quality.

label: Enology
definition: the science of wine production; an enologist is a professional winemaker; an enophile is someone who enjoys wine.

label: Fermentation
definition: the process by which sugar is transformed into alcohol; how grape juice interacts with yeast to become wine.

label: Filtration
definition: the process by which wine is clarified before bottling.

label: Fining
definition: part of the clarification process whereby elements are added to the wine, i.e. egg whites, in order to capture solids prior to filtration.

label: Fortified Wine
definition: a wine in which brandy is introduced during fermentation; sugars and sweetness are high due to the suspended fermentation.

label: Fume Blanc
definition: a name created by robert mondavi to describe dry sauvignon blanc.

label: Gamay
definition: a red grape exceedingly popular in the beaujolais region of france.

label: Gewurztraminer
definition: a sweet and spicy white grape popular in eastern france, germany, austria, northern italy, and california.

label: Graft
definition: a vineyard technique in which the bud-producing part of a grapevine is attached to an existing root.

label: Gran Reserva
definition: a spanish term used for wines that are aged in wood and bottles for at least five years prior to release.

label: Grand Cru
definition: french for 'great growth;' the very best vineyards.

label: Green
definition: a term used to describe underripe, vegetal flavors in a wine.

label: Grenache
definition: a hearty, productive red grape popular in southern france as well as in spain, where it is called garnacha.

label: Gruner Veltliner
definition: a white grape popular in austria that makes lean, fruity, racy wines.

label: Haut
definition: a french word meaning 'high.' it applies to quality as well as altitude.

label: Hectare
definition: a metric measure equal to 10,000 square meters or 2.47 acres.

label: Hectoliter
definition: a metric measure equal to 100 liters or 26.4 gallons.

label: Herbaceous
definition: an aroma or flavor similar to green; often an indication of underripe grapes or fruit grown in a cool climate.

label: Hollow
definition: a term used to describe a wine that doesnit have depth or body.

label: Hybrid
definition: the genetic crossing of two or more grape types; common hybrids include mueller-thurgau and bacchus

label: Ice Wine
definition: from the german eiswein, this is a wine made from frozen grapes; germany, austria and canada are leading ice wine producers.

label: Jeroboam
definition: an oversized bottle equal to six regular 750 ml bottles.

label: Kabinett
definition: a german term for a wine of quality; usually the driest of germanyis best rieslings.

label: Kosher
definition: a wine made according to strict jewish rules under rabbinical supervision.

label: Labrusca
definition: grape types native to north america such as concord and catawba.

label: Late Harvest
definition: a term used to describe dessert wines made from grapes left on the vines for an extra long period, often until botrytis has set in.

label: Lees
definition: heavy sediment left in the barrel by fermenting wines; a combination of spent yeast cells and grape solids.

label: Legs
definition: a term used to describe how wine sticks to the inside of a wineglass after drinking or swirling.

label: Loire
definition: a river in central france as well as a wine region famous for chenin blanc, sauvignon blanc, and cabernet franc.

label: Maceration
definition: the process of allowing grape juice and skins to ferment together, thereby imparting color, tannins, and aromas.

label: Madeira
definition: a fortified wine that has been made on a portuguese island off the coast of morocco since the fifteenth century.

label: Maderized
definition: stemming from the word madeira, this term means oxidization in a hot environment.

label: Magnum
definition: a bottle equal to two regular 750 ml bottles.

label: Malbec
definition: a hearty red grape of french origin now exceedingly popular in argentina.

label: Malolactic Fermentation
definition: a secondary fermentation, often occurring in barrels, whereby harsher malic acid is converted into creamier lactic acid.

label: Medoc
definition: a section of bordeaux on the west bank of the gironde estuary known for great red wines; margaux, st.-estephe, and pauillac are three leading aocs in the medoc.

label: Merlot
definition: a lauded red grape popular in bordeaux and throughout the world; large amounts of merlot exist in italy, the united states, south america, and elsewhere.

label: Must
definition: crushed grapes about to go or going through fermentation.

label: Nebbiolo
definition: a red grape popular in the piedmont region of northwest italy; the grape that yields both barolo and barbaresco.

label: Negociant
definition: a french term for a person or company that buys wines from others and then labels it under his or her own name; stems from the french word for 'shipper.'

label: Nose
definition: synonymous with bouquet; the sum of a wine's aromas.

label: Oaky
definition: a term used to describe woody aromas and flavors; butter, popcorn, and toast notes are found in 'oaky' wines.

label: Organic
definition: grapes grown without the aid of chemical-based fertilizers, pesticides, or herbicides.

label: Oxidized
definition: a wine that is no longer fresh because it was exposed to too much air.

label: PH
definition: an indication of a wine's acidity expressed by how much hydrogen is in it.

label: Phylloxera
definition: a voracious vine louse that over time has destroyed vineyards in europe and california.

label: Piedmont
definition: an area in northwest italy known for barolo, barbaresco, barbera, dolcetto, and moscato.

label: Pinot Blanc
definition: a white grape popular in alsace, germany, and elsewhere.

label: Pinot Gris
definition: also called pinot grigio, this is a grayish-purple grape that yields a white wine with a refreshing character.

label: Pinot Noir
definition: the prime red grape of burgundy, champagne, and oregon.

label: Pinotage
definition: a hybrid between pinot noir and cinsault thatis grown almost exclusively in south africa.

label: Plonk
definition: a derogatory name for cheap, poor-tasting wine.

label: Pomace
definition: the mass of skins, pits, and stems left over after fermentation; used to make grappa in italy and marc in france.

label: Port
definition: a sweet, fortified wine made in the douro valley of portugal and aged in the coastal town of vila nova de gaia; variations include vintage, tawny, late bottled vintage, ruby, white, and others.

label: Premier Cru
definition: french for 'first growth;' a high-quality vineyard but one not as good as grand cru.

label: Press
definition: the process by which grape juice is extracted prior to fermentation; a machine that extracts juice from grapes.

label: Primeur
definition: a french term for wine sold while it is sill in the barrels; known as 'futures' in english-speaking countries.

label: Pruning
definition: the annual vineyard chore of trimming back plants from the previous harvest.

label: Racking
definition: the process of moving wine from barrel to barrel, while leaving sediment behind.

label: Reserva
definition: a spanish term for a red wine that has spent at least three years in barrels and bottles before release.

label: Reserve
definition: a largely american term indicating a wine of higher quality; it has no legal meaning.

label: Rhone
definition: a river in southwest france surrounded by villages producing wines mostly from syrah; the name of the wine-producing valley in france.

label: Riddling
definition: the process of rotating champagne bottles in order to shift sediment toward the cork.

label: Riesling
definition: along with chardonnay, one of the top white grapes in the world; most popular in germany, alsace, and austria.

label: Rioja
definition: a well-known region in spain known for traditional red wines made from the tempranillo grape.

label: Rose
definition: french for "pink" and used to describe a category of refreshing wines that are pink in color but are made from red grapes.

label: Sancerre
definition: an area in the loire valley known mostly for wines made from sauvignon blanc.

label: Sangiovese
definition: a red grape native to tuscany; the base grape for chianti, brunello di montalcino, morellino di scansano, and others.

label: Sauternes
definition: a sweet bordeaux white wine made from botrytized semillon and sauvignon blanc.

label: Sauvignon Blanc
definition: a white grape planted throughout the world; increasingly the signature wine of new zealand.

label: Sherry
definition: a fortified wine from a denominated region in southwest spain; styles include fino, manzanilla, oloroso, and amontillado.

label: Shiraz
definition: the australian name for syrah; also used in south africa and sparingly in the united states.

label: Silky
definition: a term used to describe a wine with an especially smooth mouthfeel.

label: Solera
definition: the spanish system of blending wines of different ages to create a harmonious end product; a stack of barrels holding wines of various ages.

label: Sommelier
definition: technically a wine steward, but one potentially with a great degree of wine knowledge as well as a diploma of sorts in wine studies.

label: Spicy
definition: a term used to describe certain aromas and flavors that may be sharp, woody, or sweet.

label: Split
definition: a quarter-bottle of wine; a single-serving bottle equal to 175 milliliters.

label: Steely
definition: a term used to describe an extremely crisp, acidic wine that was not aged in barrels.

label: Stemmy
definition: a term used to describe harsh, green characteristics in a wine.

label: Super Tuscan
definition: a red wine from tuscany that is not made in accordance with established doc rules; often a blended wine of superior quality containing cabernet sauvignon and/or merlot.

label: Supple
definition: a term used to describe smooth, balanced wines.

label: Syrah
definition: a red grape planted extensively in the rhone valley of france, australia, and elsewhere; a spicy, full and tannic wine that usually requires aging before it can be enjoyed.

label: Semillon
definition: a plump white grape popular in bordeaux and australia; the base for sauternes.

label: Table Wine
definition: a term used to describe wines of between 10 and 14 percent alcohol; in europe, table wines are those that are made outside of regulated regions or by unapproved methods.

label: Tannins
definition: phenolic compounds that exist in most plants; in grapes, tannins are found primarily in the skins and pits; tannins are astringent and provide structure to a wine; over time tannins die off, making wines less harsh.

label: Tempranillo
definition: the most popular red grape in spain; common in rioja and ribera del duero.

label: Terroir
definition: a french term for the combination of soil, climate, and all other factors that influence the ultimate character of a wine.

label: Tokay
definition: a dessert wine made in hungary from dried furmint grapes.

label: Trocken
definition: german for 'dry.'

label: Varietal
definition: a wine made from just one grape type and named after that grape; the opposite of a blend.

label: Veneto
definition: a large wine-producing region in northern italy.

label: Vin Santo
definition: sweet wine from tuscany made from late-harvest trebbiano and malvasia grapes.

label: Vintage
definition: a particular year in the wine business; a specific harvest.

label: Viognier
definition: a fragrant, powerful white grape grown in the rhone valley of france and elsewhere.

label: Viticulture
definition: the science and business of growing wine grapes.

label: Yeast
definition: organisms that issue enzymes that trigger the fermentation process; yeasts can be natural or commercial.

label: Yield
definition: the amount of grapes harvested in a particular year.

label: Zinfandel
definition: a popular grape in california of disputed origin; scientists say it is related to grapes in croatia and southern italy.
